item.title: Design Museum x State of the Obvious® collection
item.description: Extending the philosophy & thinking behind our branded State of the Obvious® collection, we have designed a set of products exclusively for the Design Museum. The design of these products has been heavily influenced by the International Typographic Style from the 50s and 60s & shows an evolution from our original S/O/T/O collection. It has been designed to appeal to typography and design lovers alike. At S/O/T/O we design and produce products which not only look good but also have a useful function. The exclusive Design Museum collection consists of iPhone 3 & 4 and iPad 1 & 2 GelaSkins, Staedtler Marker Pens, USB Sticks, Travel Card Wallets and Keyrings.
item.content:encoded: Extending the philosophy & thinking behind our branded State of the Obvious® collection, we have designed a set of products exclusively for the Design Museum. The design of these products has been heavily influenced by the International Typographic Style from the 50s and 60s & shows an evolution from our original S/O/T/O collection. It has been designed to appeal to typography and design lovers alike. At S/O/T/O we design and produce products which not only look good but also have a useful function. The exclusive Design Museum collection consists of iPhone 3 & 4 and iPad 1 & 2 GelaSkins, Staedtler Marker Pens, USB Sticks, Travel Card Wallets and Keyrings.

item.description: Paintings that represents papers, pictures and viewers and the relation between reality and art.

item.title: Luxembourg & Dayan
item.description: A survey of Italian master Alberto Burris Cretti Neri paintings were exhibited in 2010. The exhibitions print pieces have a subtle gloss foil on the textured, matte black board expressing the pressure and surface changes are the hallmark of this dark and masculine post-war series.
item.content:encoded: A survey of Italian master Alberto Burris Cretti Neri paintings were exhibited in 2010. The exhibitions print pieces have a subtle gloss foil on the textured, matte black board expressing the pressure and surface changes are the hallmark of this dark and masculine post-war series.

item.title: Process of Elimination
item.description: A series of recent digital collage works utilizing appropriated imagery from antique baroque, pre-Raphaelite, romantic, neo-classical, and Victorian portraiture, among other historical imagery.
item.content:encoded: A series of recent digital collage works utilizing appropriated imagery from antique baroque, pre-Raphaelite, romantic, neo-classical, and Victorian portraiture, among other historical imagery.

item.title: Immersive Cocoon Concept
item.description: The Immersive Cocoon begins with a simple premise: the digitally created worlds that we visit every day through two-dimensional screens is quickly expanding and deepening into 3D navigable space. This 4m sphere provides the gateway to these worlds with a 360° interior dome-display and the sophisticated motion-sensing software that inspired Minority Report. Suddenly virtual space surrounds the user in built form; navigation is accomplished using simple hand gestures and intuitive body movements.
item.content:encoded: The Immersive Cocoon begins with a simple premise: the digitally created worlds that we visit every day through two-dimensional screens is quickly expanding and deepening into 3D navigable space. This 4m sphere provides the gateway to these worlds with a 360° interior dome-display and the sophisticated motion-sensing software that inspired Minority Report. Suddenly virtual space surrounds the user in built form; navigation is accomplished using simple hand gestures and intuitive body movements.
